title: GitHub - cavi-au/Consent-O-Matic: Browser extension that automatically fills out cookie popups based on your preferences

last_post.content:
Consent-O-Matic is a browser extension that auto-responds to all the #GDPR and similar consent popups with optimal user preferences.

Unlike the extension "I don't care about cookies" which just accepts all cookies, Consent-O-Matic clicks the prompts on your behalf to reject most of the cookies. You can also choose what to accept/reject in the preferences.

Available for Firefox, Chrome and others.

I've been using this on Firefox :firefox: for quite sometime now and it works great!

Their Github page has links to official extension stores: https://github.com/cavi-au/Consent-O-Matic#introduction

#AMO link: https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/addon/consent-o-matic/

title: ‘Everyone is kind of tired and has given up’ on COVID. But this new variant is ‘one to watch,’ the WHO says

last_post.content:
‘Everyone is kind of tired and has given up’ on COVID. But this new variant is ‘one to watch,’ the World Health Organisation says

XBB.1.16, dubbed “Arcturus” by variant trackers, is very similar to U.S. dominant “Kraken” XBB.1.5 —the most transmissible COVID variant yet, but additional mutations in the virus’s spike protein, which attaches to and infects human cells, has the potential to make the variant more infectious and even cause more severe disease. For this reason, and due to rising cases in the East, XBB.1.16 is considered “one to watch,” Maria Van Kerkhove, COVID-19 technical lead for the WHO says.

> My vision distorted by thick eyeglasses, I witnessed the curvature of the Earth’s horizon, and I felt the pull of gravity toward its center, such that every one of us is standing at the very apex. Each of us stands at the top of planet Earth, and each of us is a leader or captain of the “Blue Marble” team.
> [...]
> It occurred to me the weak link for the Blue Marble team is wisdom. [...] I thought if we could encourage sharing of ideas between different areas of knowledge, perhaps more of the bigger picture would emerge, and eventually more wisdom might develop. Sort of a trickle-up theory of information leading to knowledge leading to wisdom.

@ct_bergstrom The problem with AI is never about "how smart it is." The problem is the *human* cognitive bias, sometimes called the "ELIZA effect," in which people attribute human personality and intelligence to computer programs.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ELIZA_effect

The ELIZA effect is basically the same cognitive bias that makes us anthropomorphize our pets and inanimate objects, but it feels a little more scary somehow when it happens with chatbots. Anyway, the problem is not the bots but ourselves.

title: The appalling neoclassical economics of climate change from heterodox economist Steve Keen

last_post.content: @pluralistic At long last there is a heterodox (anti-neoliberal) economist who decimates the idiotic assumptions and simplistic models of the orthodoxy, or 'economism.' He is Professor Steve Keen, and he's got the math chops to "beat 'em at their own game.' He also has the Systems-Dynamics chops to have developed a S.D.-based economic modeling program, which he calls "Minsky."
